ServiceRepository

ServiceRepository

This module handles service dependant tasks such as managing list of other services and their functions, keeping track of other nodes, performing ping etc.

Note that any code and function regarding the calls should be inside undelying transportClient and transportServer

Constructor

new ServiceRepository(xyz)

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 23

Creates a new ServiceRepository Transport client and server will be composed by ServiceRepository

Parameters:
Name Type Description
xyz Object

the current xyz instance

Members

foreignNodes :Object

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 77

list of foreign nodes. should be filled by ping and should be used by send strategy

  • Object

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 84

list of foreign routes and servers. should be filled by ping and should be userPayload by send strategy when redirect: true

transport :Transport

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 42

Transport layer.

note that a ref. to xyz will be passed all the way down. this is to ensure that every middleware will have access to it and there will be no circular dependency

Methods

bindTransportEvent()

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 142

bind default events for a given server. Should not be called directly. The use can use this y setting the third parameter to registerServer, e to true. This will case this method to be called.

this method will cause services to be searched an invoked via CONSTANTS.events.MESSAGE event, which is equal to message. This event will be emitter by default from http.receive.event.js middleware.

forget() → {null}

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 214

Will cause both the ServiceRepository and CONFIG to forget about all foreign info. This includes foreignNodes, foreignRoutes and systemConf.nodes[] to be flushed. Note that this method should be called, not the one in CONFIG

Returns:
Type
null

override the default console.log function

inspectJSON()

  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 125

same as inspect() in JSON format

logSystemUpdates()

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 228

Should be called after any chnage to the configurations of the system

register(path, fn)

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 103

Register a new service at a given path.

The first parameter path will indicate the path of the service. Note that this path must be valid.

xyz.register() will invoke this method

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String

path of the service
fn function

function to be registered

terminate()

Source:
  • src/Service/service.repository.js, line 235

will stop all servers of the system. should be used in test only.
